title: ICE When initializing a struct with update syntax in closure

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-beta
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from stable to beta.

body:
## TL;DR When initializing a struct with update syntax inside a closure, an ICE occurs if a nonexistent or misspelled member is listed. ## Example that Triggers ICE ```rust struct Point { pub x: u64, pub y: u64, } const TEMPLATE: Point = Point { x: 0, y: 0 }; fn main() { let x = || { Point { nonexistent: 0, ..TEMPLATE } }; } ```
